title.narrative: Promover la conservación y uso sostenible de la biodiversidad marina y costera en las regiones Pacífica y Caribe, a través del diseño e implementación de un Sistema de Areas Marinas Protegidas (SAMP) financieramente sostenible y bien manejado.

description.narrative: Promover la conservación y uso sostenible de la biodiversidad marina y costera en las regiones Pacífica y Caribe, a través del diseño e implementación de un Sistema de Areas Marinas Protegidas (SAMP) financieramente sostenible y bien manejado.
bay

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

description.narrative: Colombian and international communities are aware of and support the SMPA
Percentage of the Colombian population aware of the existence and importance of the SMPA and that fully supports it

comment.narrative:
The target level at end of project was reformulated in the Management Response according to the recommendations of the mid term evaluation before we have 20 now is 2 Colombian population aware of the existence and importance of the SMPA and that fully supports it
The implementation of awarenessraising program and the different campaigns in the media and social networks of the project will be help with this goal This percentage will be evaluated with the surveys in the third quarter of the year
Participation with a project stand and many conferences at the COLACMARSENALMAR XVI Latin American Congress on Marine Science and Technology and National Seminar on Science and Technology of the Sea that will be held in Santa Marta as well as the participation in the International MPA or Protected Areas Conferences will be very helpful for dissemination of the results of the project

description.narrative: Changes in behavior and attitudes towards MPAs measured by an attitudebehavioral scale contribute to the conservation of coastal and marine biodiversity

comment.narrative: Behavior and attitude test scores to be established within first 6 months of project implementation
10 of increase over the baseline in test result on behavior and attitudes

The target level at end of project was reformulated in the Management Response according to the recommendations of the mid term evaluation before we have 15 now is 10 of increase over the baseline in test results
The operation of the site from social networks Facebook and Twitter has been strengthened with the publication of videos photos messages and interaction with other networks With the following statistics Facebook 1971 followers Twitter 1101 followers YouTube 576 plays and 3 subscribers and Google 7599 visits achieving in number of visitors by publication in an average of 13207 compared with the previous year which was 3500 According to the document of the project surveys to assess the change in the perception and behavior will be delivered at the in the third quarter of the current year

description.narrative: Number of awareness programs undertaken

comment.narrative: Zero 0
One 1

Voices of the sea awareness campaign Black Theatre was made in the MPA National Park Corales del Rosario and San Bernardo with intervention on the beaches of San Antero Coveñas Mucura Island Timtipan island and Tolu during June 11 to 15 The campaign delivered messages to encourage tourism responsible consumption with the sea and its MPs This managed a range of 3000 visitors in the beaches and additionally this event was published live on social networks making a number of visits scope of 2519 and being published in regional and national media

description.narrative: Number of funding proposals leveraged by the Friends of the SMPA Society

At least five 5 proposals by project end

The call for financial support for the network friends of the SAMP is now open to 5 productive projects or business ideas related to the MPA this is a funding strategy that will support the financial sustainability of the MPAS as well as the promotion of increase the Friends of the SMPA Society and generate additional financial resources by the inkind or cash counterpart by each proponent because for apply to the call it requires at least 40 of counterpart

description.narrative: Number of higher education institutions ie ecology programs that include MPA management as part of their curricula

comment.narrative: Zero 0
Six 6

Six 6 higher education institutions include MPA elective lecture as a part of their curricula in the PhD in Marine Science DCIM initials in Spanish from November 2015 in this PhD are involved 6 universities in the country that have programs in marine or coastal topics National University UJTL University of Magdalena Northern University University of Antioquia University of Valle
The project also made the approach with local universities like Technological University of Chocó specifically with the Director of Agroforestal Engineering programme to include MPA management module in its curriculum As the Director of the programme affirmed the idea is to include MPA management module as an elective lecture for Biology and Agroforestal Engineering The official letter with the proposal was already send by the SMPA project still waiting for a response

description.narrative: The SMPA is established and supported by a legal institutional and operational framework
Existence of the SMPA as part of the SINAP

comment.narrative: No official SMPA
The SMPA is legally established

The SMPA is legally established
Decree regulating the National Protected Areas System SINAP initials in Spanish includes within it the creation of thematic subsystems that constitute a set of protected areas social and institutional actors management tools and instruments for its articulation looking for common conservation objectives and addressing specific logical drive From there the support of the SMPA arises from the existing regulatory framework of SINAP SMPA have legal basis making use of the existing regulatory framework for SINAP Within this regulation framework its created an organization that seeks to integrate management of the subsystems and for the discussions of policies and regulations of them The National council for protected areas CONAP initials in Spanish chaired by the Minister of Environment becomes the stage for generating reflections against the regulatory framework and give recognition to the SMPA through the integration of a delegate for it in the CONAP Having an action plan for the subsystem with a coordinating organization and a delegate to the CONAP will shape the SPMA within the existing regulatory framework and give legal backing to it
Inclusion of the SMPA as part of this Decree was approved within the Management Response
The conceptualization of the SMPA in Colombia document was also published Currently SMPA is articulated with the action plans of the Caribbean and Pacific Regional Protected Areas Systems SIRAPs initials in Spanish

description.narrative: Number of MPAs within the SMPA

comment.narrative: Zero 0
Up to 26 MPAs by project end

31 MPAs by the end of 2014 with in the SMPA Surpassing the target Up to 26 MPAs were proposed as a target
According with the mid term evaluation the project promote the creation of MPAs and it is very successful in generate institutional awareness for it in other words the GEFSMPA Project put in the national subnational and local agendas the marine conservation topics
30 AMP have been registered on the Colombia Protected Areas National Register RUNAP initials in Spanish the Archipelago del Rosario San Bernardo e Isla Fuerte Marine Protected Area it is not even registered

description.narrative: Number of Regional Action Plans with clearly defined guidelines for MPA management

comment.narrative: Zero 0
Two 2 Caribbean SIRAP and Pacific SIRAP

Articulated work with Caribbean and Pacific SIRAP has continued as in the previous period through participation in the areas of technical and management committees of both SIRAPs
There is a framework agreement for cooperation signed in September of 2014 between the Colombian Caribbean Protected Areas Regional System SIRAP and INVEMAR to join efforts for the implementation of the MPAS on Caribbean SIRAP through the creation of a coordination instance between the SIRAP and INVEMAR to its consolidation within the framework of the SINAP

description.narrative: Change in the financial gap to cover basic MPA management costs and investments

comment.narrative: 1632690 10 reduction

The calculation is currently developing the financial gap to cover basic costs of management of MPAs and investments we will get results for the years 2009 to 2015 and a projection for the next four years on July 2015

description.narrative: Number of agreements established with direct beneficiaries of marine conservation and MPA users that contribute to the financial sustainability of the SMPA

comment.narrative: Zero 0
At least two 2 agreements one for the Caribbean region and one for the Pacific region

The first agreement on recreation rates to actors involved in diving activities culminated with the issuance of the resolution number 031 on January 30 2014 amending resolution No 245 of 2012 that regulates the income value of rights to the Park National Natural Corals of the Rosary and San Bernardo The value of the rights of entry was increased in the PNN taking into account the costs of planning programming control and monitoring to meet the object of conservation
During 2014 an additional charge based on the agreement with tourism operators and supported by economic analyses was implemented for Corales del Rosario and Gorgona protected areas
On May 2015 a formal document Resolución from the National Natural Parks was signed concerning the payment for vessel transit in the MPA Although a preliminary agreement has been made with DIMAR a software application and a formal agreement is needed for DIMAR to charge the vessels on a biannual basis along with other regulatory charges they have
With respect to fisheries agreements the Tribugá agreement was signed on 21 April 2015 Cispata agreement will be signed in July
For the case of the agreement for vessels transit this instrument is being analyzed in terms of legal feasibility and the final report will be delivered in the third quarter of 2015

description.narrative: Number of avoided mangrove deforestation pilot projects

comment.narrative: Zero 0
One 1 by project end

One pilot project of avoided mangrove deforestation is taking place in DMI Cispata is very succesful Their lessons learned allowed to applied the methodology in the Pacific coast Carbon measurements were made in the plot of Luisico Malaga Bay on October 2014 and March 2015
Socialization to communities of mangrove workers on the Pilot Project REDD DMI Cispata La Balsa and Tinajones was made in order to keep communities informed and to define the next steps for the implementations of the project
We have been achieved progress in the development of a methodological guide for avoided deforestation projects on mangroves within voluntary carbon strategies in order to document the experience to other areas in the Neotropic not only as a financial sustainability strategy for the mangrove protected areas but also as a climate change mitigation strategy linked with the conservation processes

description.narrative: Number of business plans for regional MPAs

comment.narrative: Zero 0
At least four 4 by project end

Four business plans three of them are finalized and one is ongoing
Three business plans have been formulated a Business Plan of tourist services in the Tribugá DRMI b business plan for the oyster mangrove in DMI Cispata San Antero Córdoba C business plan for PNR Old Point
On going plan is Business Plan of tourist guides in the DRMI Caimanera Sucre

The results demonstrate that in general key ecosystem cover has been maintained in relation to the reference levels The project has carried out increasingly detailed measurements with high resolution remote sensing which has allowed for verification and adjustment of the extent of the ecosystems in the seven MPAs The updated information is
Mangrove 5190290 ha
Beach 4907244 m
Coastal cliff 7066336 m
Coral reefs 2101053 ha
Seagrass 642602 ha
The data remains the same because the change in coverage of key coastal and marine ecosystems realized in 2015 is still in process
2015 monitoring about change in coverage of key coastal and marine ecosystems will be executed in the second part of the year
